reviewText: I keep humming the theme song to LarryBoy and I'm okay with that.  These movies complement other superhero stories and brings them to early childhood with straight-forward lessons.  My four-year-old daughter watches the movies frequently and enjoys the combination of storylines.

reviewText: This is a great pack of Larryboy!  It inclues Dave and the Giant Pickle, where Larryboy makes his very first appearance; Larryboy and the Fib from Outer Space, Larryboy's first "full length" adventure; Larryboy and the Rumor Weed, Larryboy's second adventure; and all the Larryboy cartoons.  This is an affordable way to have it all!
summary: More Larryboy than you'll know what to do with!
Title: N/A

reviewText: When Bumblyberg needs a hero, who do they call?  Larry-Boy, that's who!  This VeggieTales Bumblyberg Superhero Value Pack features four discs of family values and family fun with the focus on the VeggieTales' resident superhero, Larry-Boy.  The stories included are "Larry-Boy and the Fib From Outer Space," "Larry-Boy and the Rumor Weed," "Dave and the Giant Pickle," and a fourth disc featuring Larry-Boy's Cartoon Adventures.Bonus features included on the discs are trivia games, Behind the Scenes featurettes, hilarious Veggie Karaoke, and many more.  There are also a few Easter eggs hidden on the discs for those who want to find them.My personal favorite feature is the "How to draw" series that teaches kids (and parents) how to draw characters from the show.I also like the fact that you can actually see the production quality of VeggieTales improve if you watch the shows in chronological order.  It's great to see that such a wonderful children's program keeps improving.If you have a young child who has fallen in love with Larry-Boy, this value pack is the best deal you can find.  It's family friendly, hilarious for children and adults, and encourages children to think about the consequences of the things that they do.Highly recommended.

reviewText: These stories, as with most Veggie Tales stories, have worth while messages. In addition to the messages, my son enjoys watching them repeatedly. He often pretends to be Larryboy, and I'll be Bob the tomato. He even carries cucumbers and tomatoes around the house making them talk and act our his favorite episodes.
summary: Easy to watch more than once
Title: N/A

reviewText: I completely agree 100% with the person who said this was money well spent! 4 DVDs for the price I paid? Doesn't seem logical, but it WAS a deal, and we took it! You want to see everything Larry-Boy that is out? Well, look no further. And I wanna tell you something. My daughter is a sucker for a purple suit with plunger ears! Now, what do you really get out of all this? We got 4 DVDs as I said, and I'll list them below.#1; Larry-Boy and the Fib From Outer Space: Not exactly the start of Larry-Boy in general, but the first Larry-Boy episode. It is simply about Junior, and how a little lie turns into a big problem. The question is, can Larry-Boy actually do anything to stop this problem? I think this is kind of signature Larry-Boy, because my wife and I hadn't heard of any other episodes but the cartoons, and this one. Riley, our daughter, loves the theme song by Nicole Mullen!#2; Larry-Boy and the Rumor Weed: This would probably be our daughter's personal favorite out of the whole 4 pack. It is simply about a rumor that Junior Asparagus and Laura Carrot get going when confronted by a suspicious looking weed. "Did ya hear the one about Alfred?" Things get a little hairy, and some things grow to huge proportions in this story. Our daughter personally LOVES what I'd call "The Rumor Weed Rap". She just be-bops about when that song goes, and she thinks it is the coolest!#3; Dave and the Giant Pickle: OK! Now, yes this is VeggieTales, yet it where Larry-Boy begins. It is where Larry isn't feeling very special, and Bob tells him a story about a boy named Dave. Yep, this where Larry-Boy first started, and look at him now! He is that hero!!!#4; The Cartoon Adventures of Larry-Boy: This is something different, and it doesn't have any special features. But to make up for it, it does feature all 4 Larry-Boy Cartoons, and they are all really good! The 4 cartoons are entitled, "The Angry Eyebrows", "The Yodelnapper", "Leggo My Ego" and "The Good, the Bad, and the Eggly!" All 4 of these are really good.What we all learn with Larry-Boy is that sometimes we need a hero. In reality, there are all kinds of people who are looking for people, whomever they may be to be THAT hero. So while it entertains our kids and teaches them valuable lessons, let's try and be heros to our little ones! Are you THAT HERO?
summary: Absolutely EVERYTHING Larry-Boy!!! Lots and lots of fun!!!
Title: N/A
